text: With the AbstractPlotting `Figure` rework it should be possible to get better integration with AlgebraOfGraphics. StatsMakie implementation was very hacky, but I liked the idea of just overloading `plot` with a few special types. Is that the type of syntax you would prefer or did you have something else in mind?

text: Gadfly is so different from Makie though, I thought our current approach is closer to matplotlib but well. I like grammar of graphics as well but I usually hit boundaries really quickly and then I have to do things manually anyway. Hopefully we can just support all kinds of different use cases. Gadfly felt quite restrictive to me when I tried it two years ago. I couldn't even have a frame around the axis because it seems that was already too opinionated

text: Pietro I thought the existing AlgebraOfGraphics implementation was quite good already, but I think it's important that it's easy to use it alongside normal makie. So adding a AoG plot into a Figure slot for example should be easy, and also manipulating it after creating it.

text: I think there is a lot of value in using AoG to explore your data, quickly test ideas and new venues with minimal code and twicking, and then go how ever manual you like/need for the publication figures. That is a great combination. In fact, I'd go as far as to say that that is the goal: have something that is consistent, correct, andquick as AoG to detect trends (i.e. real signals, conclusions) in the data, and then something as configurable as possible to showcase those trends in the best way possible (i.e. easiest for the reader to understand).

text: Yes, I think some of the current awkwardness is because of the (now fixed AFAIU) Makie / MakieLayout split... My hope is that with the Figure thing, AoG can just give the uncustomized plot and then you can fine tune it as a normal figure, so that we don't need to cram all the fine-tuning functionality in AoG. My impression is that there is no end to the things people want to fine tune, so I'd really like to outsource that problem :slightly_smiling_face:
